result.execSummary:
The defendant Glen P. Popp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution to come out of inmate wages at a rate of 25% and any remaining amount is ordered as a condition of extended supervision.
Full time employment/schooling/combination; if not, perform 8 hours community service per month.
No contact with L.D. or any member of her family.  Absolute sobriety.  No purchase/possession of any alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed and taken as prescribed.
Counseling/assessment as deemed appropriate by the agent.  Letter of apology to the victim.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle T&R in defendants name is subject to IID, as is defendant himself.

for Half-Priced Ignition Interlock Device (IID)

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:38 am 
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Lou Ann Bohn. 
COURT notes PSI and asks if there are any corrections/additions. Atty Bohn notes corrections to PSI. COURT notes victim impact statement filed at time of plea hearing. VRCW. 
Atty Bohn makes statement. Deft makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1 (OWI 6th)>>6 years imprisonment - 3 years initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision; Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 3 years, as is the defendant himself; 3 years dl revocation with administrative credit; $2182 inclusive and $500 restitution to victim - to come out of inmate wages at rate of 25% and any remaining amount is ordered as a condition of ES; CONDITIONS OF ES - mantain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of if not perform 8 hours community service per week; 8 hours of community service per month; no contact with L.D. or any memeber of her family; letter of apology to victim; Absolute sobriety; No purchase/possess any alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed and taken as prescribed; counseling/assessment as deemed appropriate by the agent; AODA. 
COURT notes DNA sample has already been provided. 
COURT find the deft is entitled to 129 days credit. 
COURT finds the deft eligible for SAP and not eligible for CIP. 
COURT ORDERS half-priced IID. 
State returns PSI; Atty Bohn retains copy of PSI. 
Adj: 9:01 am
sbc - stj
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Sentencing hearing on June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Clerk Marisa.

INCLUDES 14CF108 AND 14TR657
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Lou Ann Bohn. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.
State notes plea agreement on the record. Court states intent to order PSI. Court questions Atty Bohn regarding proceeding with plea. 
OTR: 1:22 pm BOTR: 1:25 pm 
Atty Bohn states def wishes to proceed with plea today. 

State moves to: 
In 14CF108: Ct. 2 (Hit and Run)>>D&RI. 
In 14TR657>>Dismiss File. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: In 14CF108: Ct. 1 (OWI 6th)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: PSI. 
Sentencing set for June 9, 2014 at 8:30 am in Br. 3.

and Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Court questions State regarding its position re: furlough. Court questions deft regarding reason for multi-day request. Court denies motion at this time.
